Title: Campus Recruiter
RoleDescription:
The base salary for this position is $64,000 - $73,250. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
This position is full time and is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA. This role is not a virtual / remote position - 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH. This is an entry level recruiter role. At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.
Wayfair is looking for a Campus Recruiter to join our Campus and Early Careers Recruiting Team in Boston, MA. The Campus and Early Careers Recruiting Team is dedicated to attracting and hiring promising students for internships and top entry-level talent to fuel the company's growth. Our team serves as the primary link between Wayfair and academic institutions, playing a crucial role in building a pipeline of future talent.
As a member of this team, you will act as a business partner, managing the full-cycle recruitment process and ensuring an exceptional candidate experience.  You will be part of a team that builds a strong employer brand on college campuses, making Wayfair a top choice for aspiring graduates. This role is ideal for a recruiter who is excited by the dynamic landscape of early career talent acquisition.
What You'll Do:

Source and screen candidates: Actively identify and engage with potential candidates through various channels, including online platforms and professional networks. You'll review resumes and help manage candidates through the recruitment process.
Manage the candidate pipeline: Use our Applicant Tracking System (ATS) to track and manage candidate data, ensuring a seamless and positive experience for all applicants.
Collaborate with hiring partners: Work closely with hiring managers and other recruiters to understand their needs and align on campus recruitment strategies.
Improve existing processes: Develop innovative approaches to secure campus talent.
Manage events and programs: Support Wayfair's Summer Internship Program and other campus events as needed.

What You'll Need:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Human Resources, Communications, Business). 
Strong communication skills: You should be comfortable speaking in front of groups and engaging with people from diverse backgrounds.
Excellent organizational skills: You'll need to manage multiple projects and events simultaneously, with a keen eye for detail.
Comfort with data: Ability to use metrics to guide decision-making.
A strong interest in emerging technology, including the use of generative AI tools to drive efficiencies.
A passion for people: You should be genuinely excited about helping students find their next career opportunity and showcasing Wayfair's culture.
1+ year previous experience in recruiting, human resources, event planning, or related fields.

Title: Strategy & Execution Manager
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $99,000 - $110,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.Must be onsite in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)Wayfair is seeking a highly motivated manager to lead Physical Retail Strategy & Execution for our Specialty Retail Brands. This role will be instrumental in shaping the future of how customers engage with our Speciality Retail Brands and offering. You'll be responsible for developing and executing on a comprehensive roadmap, spearheading innovative projects, and partnering with teams like store leadership, tech, and analytics to improve the customer and store associate experience. This role comes with the potential to build the team out more as the business grows.

Strategic Roadmapping: Develop and execute a roadmap of actionable, data-backed initiatives to grow store top line, identifying key opportunities for growth, market differentiation, and customer experience enhancements. This includes defining new service offerings, technology requirements, and operational efficiencies.

You'll identify trends, pinpoint areas for improvement, and implement data-driven strategies to optimize performance.

What You'll Need

5+ years of experience in business development, strategy, operations, or a related field, with a proven track record of driving growth in a fast-paced environment.
Prior experience with physical retail a plus
Demonstrated ability to develop and execute strategic roadmaps, with a strong understanding of how to translate vision into actionable plans.
Exceptional cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely to all levels of the organization.

Title: Senior Analyst, Global Delivery Performance Management
RoleDescription:
The base salary for this position is $104,500 - 118,250 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
The Global Performance Management team is looking for advanced analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individuals that can translate business problems to actionable insights and data driven solutions to influence operational results. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.  
The Global Performance Management team within Transportation & Delivery (T&D) is responsible for improving all areas of business with accurate and dependable reporting. To do so, we leverage an end-to-end view of the supply chain and use data to identify key opportunity areas, build business cases, and work with partners in operations on implementation. We also manage the data infrastructure for the T&D team and partner with upstream teams to maintain sources of truths and metric definitions.

Perform analysis across large data sets to develop performance insights and highlight operational opportunities. 
Develop key metrics and reporting to measure how initiatives are improving Wayfairs performance and enabling our team to easily identify trends, root causes and develop targeted action plans.
Leverage a deep understanding of Supply Chain principles to design new initiatives aimed at improving the speed and/or capabilities of Wayfairs delivery network.
Leverage critical thinking and data handling to examine and challenge existing practices, identify opportunities for improvement, and gain buy-in from stakeholders on proposals.
Collaborate with cross-functional partners in Operations and Tech to support the rollout of new operational initiatives and/or tech capabilities. 
Ensure that there is strong alignment between Wayfairs business objectives and our data-driven strategies.
Conduct thorough ad-hoc analysis.
Build dashboards to translate large data sets into driving insights and action.
Monitor KPIs and assess how were making progress against business objectives and occasionally present findings to senior leadership.

Master's with 1-2 years of experience or Bachelors degree with 3-4 years of experience.
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI).
Experience in Supply Chain and/or E-Commerce is a plus.
Excellent communication, both written and verbally.
Collaborative mindset that thrives as part of a team.
Data and process-oriented, demonstrated ability to continuously learn new tools.
High attention to detail and thorough attention to data integrity to deliver trusted insights.
Proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
Ability to navigate an environment of continuous improvement working through ambiguity in an evolving organization.

Title: Sales Quality Assurance Manager
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $89,100 - $110,000. The base salary  offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Who We Are
The Sales Quality Assurance team is at the heart of our commitment to customer excellence. We ensure that every sales conversation, whether with a business or an individual customer, is of the highest quality. We do this by developing and implementing strategies that not only drive profitable growth but also create exceptional customer experiences.
 
What You'll Do
As a Sales Quality Assurance Manager, you'll lead a team of analysts focused on maintaining and elevating the quality of our sales conversations across both B2B and B2C channels. You will be responsible for creating and executing a robust quality assurance roadmap that leverages technology, data, and human expertise. Measurement & Analytics: Manage the development and enhancement of quality rubrics and reporting, using data to draw conclusions and drive improvements.
Technology & Innovation: Collaborate with technology partners to provide feedback on tools, influence their roadmaps, and explore new solutions.

Requirements:

Bachelors degree in Business or Finance
7+ years experience working in a contact center environment running quality programs
5+ years leadership experience
Sales experience a plus
Evidence of solving problems through a mix of critical thinking, persuasion, relationship building, and scrappiness
The ability to analyze data, draw conclusions, and create reporting
Experience using AI powered Quality analytics tools
A proven track record of providing feedback on existing processes and providing recommendations for improvement 
A customer-first orientation; able to set a direction and work alongside a team to bring that vision to life
Excellent relationship-building skills both within the a team environment and throughout an organization ranging throughout all levels of the organization

Title: Facility Manager, Wayfair Stores
RoleDescription:
Facility Manager
"This position will be located in Atlanta, GA"
The base pay for this position is $90,000 - $100,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Overview:
At Wayfair, we create spaces where our customers and our teams can thrive. As a Facility Manager, youll be the cornerstone of a safe, well-maintained, and efficient retail environment. Youll lead with a service-first mindset, managing a high-performing team and third-party partners to ensure our facility runs smoothly, 24/7. From preventative maintenance and emergency response to vendor oversight and budget planning, your work will directly support a best-in-class shopping experience and a safe, inspiring place for our teams to work. If youre passionate about operational excellence, safety, and team development, this may be your professional home.
 
What Does a Facilities Manager Do?

 Lead with Safety & Purpose: View every action through a safety-first lens while creating a clean, secure environment for customers and associates.
 Manage & Mentor the Team: Train, schedule, and work alongside a team of 3+ facilities professionals while promoting a culture of safety, service, and accountability.
 Drive Preventative Maintenance: Oversee the execution of a comprehensive PM program with a 90%+ on-time completion rate minimizing downtime and keeping operations humming.
 Own Vendor Relationships: Manage third-party partners in key service areas including fire/life safety, vertical transportation, janitorial, pest control and more, ensuring performance and compliance.
 Use Data to Prioritize & Plan: Leverage Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) and building management systems to analyze performance, prioritize tasks, and implement energy conservation strategies.
 Stay Ahead of the Schedule: Coordinate and communicate maintenance shutdowns, inspections, and compliance activities to minimize business disruption.
 Support Emergencies Proactively: Be available for off-hour response, lead root-cause analyses, and ensure transparent communication and documentation.
 Lead with Financial Acumen: Manage operational and capital budgets with a strategic eye toward maximizing ROI for the business.
 Ensure Regulatory Compliance: Maintain all building safety, environmental, and maintenance standards across local, state, and federal regulations.
 Understand Systems & Blueprints: Bring strong knowledge of mechanical, plumbing, electrical, and automation systems plus the ability to read and interpret architectural plans.


Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Facilities Expertise: 6+ years of facilities management experience, including vendor management, contract negotiation, and building operations oversight.
 Strong Financial Acumen: Confidence in managing departmental budgets and CapEx planning with strategic foresight.
 Leadership & Coaching Skills: A proven track record of building high-performing teams and mentoring team members for growth and accountability.
 Organizational Superpowers: Excellent project management, time management, and prioritization abilities to juggle multiple deadlines.
 Clear Communicator: Outstanding written and verbal communication skills for cross-functional and vendor collaboration.
 Analytical Thinker: A data-driven mindset that informs planning, problem-solving, and operational improvements.
 Tech-Forward Mindset: Familiarity with CMMS platforms (e.g., Maintenance Connection) and comfort using Google Suite and building automation systems.
 Retail Know-How (Strongly Preferred): Experience in large-format or big-box retail settings is a strong plus!
 Certifications (Strongly Preferred): Credentials from IFMA (CFM) or BOMA (FMC) are a bonus that elevates your application.

 
Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Ability to lift and move up to 50 lbs independently on a regular basis. Some projects may involve heavier items, which must be managed with proper assistance or equipment.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazards, and must adhere to all safety protocols.

 
What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance-based increases..
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you love with a generous Wayfair employee discount.
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
 And So Much More: Weve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!

RoleDescription:
Summer 2025 Start
Location: Boston, MA
Additional Details:

This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation (Monday - Thursday) with 1 day remote (Friday).
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN
The salary range for this position is $80,000 - $84,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have up to 3 years of experience.
Who We Are:Wayfairs Operations organization is revolutionizing the customer experience through the development of a proprietary logistics network and optimization platform that manages inventory from overseas factories to customers front door. This team works directly with suppliers, vendors, and customers to provide new levels of efficiency and performance. They also interact internally with Product, Engineering, and Business Intelligence teams to generate the core analytical insights that enable Wayfair to tackle transportation, warehousing, and delivery challenges. As an Analyst, youll develop and execute strategies that generate competitive advantage for Wayfair, and the results of your findings will improve the day-to-day efficiency of a complex and sophisticated global supply chain.
We are looking for analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individuals that can translate business problems to actionable insights and data driven solutions to influence operational results. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.
What You'll Do 

Manage processes and drive engagement with key cross-functional partners
Leverage analytical methods and visualization to translate data sets into actionable insights to drive business decisions and outcomes
Conduct ad hoc analyses and build reporting in Google Sheets
Communicate regularly with cross functional partners to understand the health of Wayfairs supply chain network and determine ways to break down problems into action-oriented solutions
Develop and drive adherence to sustainable long-term performance management frameworks to improve performance across multiple process paths in our supply chain
Monitor key performance indicators and assess how were making progress against our core metrics and OKRs
Work cross-functionally with a variety of teams including Warehousing, Transportation, Technology, and Supplier facing teams.
Willingness to travel 2550% of the time for business needs.

What You'll Need Basic Qualifications

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience.
Experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
Familiarity with any programming language (R, Python) is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings 
Strong consultative skills: ability to work effectively and persuasively with a highly cross- functional group of business partners
High attention to detail, zero-defect analysis and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Strong business acumen: ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective 
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change 

 
Possible Team Placements Include:

Network Planning and Orchestration: The Network Planning and Orchestration team is a part of Network Management (NM), sits at the heart of Wayfairs supply chain. They play a key role in planning, coordinating, and managing performance across Warehouses, Transportation, and Technology to ensure SLAs are met and customer orders flow smoothly. NM sets SLAs for the network to optimize Speed, Cost and Capacity, performance manages teams against these and stands up process improvement projects to optimize the network around these SLAs.
Global Supply Chain: Wayfair's Global Supply Chain (GSC) team is a network of interconnected global departments that support the journey of a product once an order is placed. This includes teams that manage all aspects of the Transportation & Delivery function, teams that support the frontline operations, and teams that manage and monetize Returns & Incidents. The objective of the GSC team is to get orders to customers' homes quickly, reliably, and conveniently, while enhancing the customer experience by preventing and reducing product defects. As a part of the GSC team, you will have an important role in accomplishing our mission: delivering cost-efficient perfect orders at scale.
Global Service: The global service teams are responsible for setting the standards on how we deliver an excellent experience to our customers. RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $172,180 - $185,424 CAD per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
This is a hybrid role based out of our Toronto, Ontario office (Tuesday - Thursday Onsite, Monday / Friday remote)
Who We Are
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Customer Technology team builds and scales the platforms that enable Wayfair to deliver exceptional customer experiences across storefront, service, and financial products. Within this Customer technology organization, the Fintech & Loyalty team ensures customers have a seamless and rewarding journey by powering payments, financing, and loyalty programs.
The Fintech & Loyalty Data Science team aims to unlock & enable high quality product insights and develop innovative data products. We collaborate with Product, Engineering, Finance, Commercial and various external partners across diverse payments and financial products to improve and evolve our customers' purchase experiences. 
As a Data Scientist III for Customer Tech, your goal is to unlock insights and guide the business in the data domain. This includes everything from advising on technical implementation tradeoffs and priorities (e.g. funnel efficiencies, loyalty & card program growth etc.) to developing broad level strategic direction and vision in our customer data strategy and architecting the future data models to meet our users needs and anticipating impactful use cases. All while maintaining data quality and analytical rigor. To be successful, this role requires a blend of analytical experience, strong technical capability, ability to develop and influence business strategy, and stakeholder management; all applied to drive the quality, impactfulness, and vision of  Wayfairs customer data. 
What You'll Do

Define and own the strategic agenda to unlock insights and guide the business
Run open-ended exploratory data analysis to identify new ideas and opportunities
Champion the use of generative AI tools to accelerate analysis, automate repetitive tasks, and enhance insight generation.
Design and drive A/B tests of our latest technology being implemented ( e.g., new financing offers, rewards features, or personalized incentives) to ensure effective and accurate data capture for experimentation reporting
Own P&L reporting for Fintech & Loyalty programs, ensuring accurate tracking of financial performance and key metrics.
Proactively monitor our data to identify potential issues, determine root causes, and resolve. 
Build new tools and pipelines that allow us to be more productive and efficient.
Work closely and build productive relationships with our product, engineering,finance, commercial and machine learning stakeholders.
Proactively identify areas where advanced analytical efforts can produce a strong value add and work them into the road map.
Communicate key insights and recommendations to cross-functional executive leaders across the organization

What You'll Need

Bachelors in computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
4+ years work experience in a relevant field (in addition to any graduate education).
Analytics or Data Science experience with e-commerce or fintech companies is a strong plus.
In-depth experience with SQL (aggregate functions, query optimization, stored procedures, string parsing, GBQ/Spark, etc.), required.
In-depth experience with python & python tools (Jupyter notebooks, functions, pandas, sklearn, matplotlib, etc.), required.
Experience with experimental design (A/B tests) and statistical analysis to drive business decision making.
Experience with Looker (or similar BI tools) for reporting and dashboarding.
Knowledge and experience using machine learning algorithms/techniques (decision trees, random forest, deep learning, etc.) within a business context, highly preferred. 
Strong written and verbal communication with a team player, highly collaborative attitude. 
Ability to collaborate and proactively communicate with stakeholders.
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Thrive in a fast-paced environment. 
Strong business acumen, analytical skills, and technical abilities along with problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated success influencing senior level stakeholders on strategic direction based on recommendations backed by in-depth analysis.
Prior experience proactively identifying areas where analytical efforts can produce a strong business value add and setting the analytics roadmap.
Able to manage multiple projects and deliver against aggressive goals.

Wayfair is looking for a driven, customer focused partner to lead our global Onboarding & Continuous Learning team. In this role, you will set the strategy for how we onboard and integrate thousands of new Wayfairians each year. In partnership with your direct team and key partners across the business, you will uncover data-driven onboarding opportunities and build end-to-end solutions to address our critical growth needs for Wayfairs global employee base. Thrives in a fast paced environment; works with urgency

Highly organized and effective at managing timelines, delivery, and communication across teams
Excellent interpersonal and team building skills, but also able to work autonomously
Able to independently manage competing priorities and support team in prioritizing
Self-motivated and determined
Demonstrates a relentless customer focus as it relates to program participants and talent stakeholders
Knowledge of Google Suite
Aptitude to upskill quickly on new platforms and processes

Title: Manager of Field Tech and Execution
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $99,000 - $110,000. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
This is a remote position - must be open to 50% travel with flexibility to work weekends and holidays as necessary.
About the Role
The Field Execution Manager for Global Safety and Security Technology and Systems will play a pivotal role in managing and optimizing Wayfairs physical security infrastructure across global operations. This position will manage projects and service, maintain infrastructure uptime, and collaborate on system designs of new and retrofit initiatives. 
The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in security systems, exceptional problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally with internal stakeholders and external partners. This role requires hands-on expertise, strategic thinking, and the ability to drive continuous improvement in safety and security operations.
What Youll Do 
Project Execution & Coordination

Lead the delivery of security technology projects from initiation through completion, ensuring milestones are met on time and within scope.
Coordinate on-site installation, integration, and deployment of security systems, working closely with vendors and field teams to ensure smooth execution.
Track project progress, resolve roadblocks, and escalate issues when necessary to keep initiatives on schedule.

Operational Support & Compliance

Support the rollout of security technology initiatives by creating, updating, or following established SOPs and ensuring consistent application across locations.
Conduct operational checks and participate in audits to confirm systems are functioning as intended and meet compliance requirements.
Provide clear documentation and status updates to stakeholders to maintain transparency and accountability.

Stakeholder Engagement

Serve as the primary point of contact during project execution, ensuring alignment between internal teams, vendors, and external partners.
Collaborate with Legal, Talent Management, IT, and Operations to ensure operational requirements match project deliverables.
Build and maintain strong vendor relationships to ensure timely service and quality outcomes.

Incident Response Support

Assist in responding to and resolving security incidents by coordinating on-the-ground actions and ensuring follow-up tasks are completed.
Document findings from incidents to inform process improvements and prevent recurrence.

Continuous Improvement

Provide feedback from field execution to inform future project planning and technology enhancements.
Stay informed on operational best practices to recommend incremental improvements in efficiency and effectiveness.

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree in a relevant field or 5+ years of experience in access control, camera and VMS systems, alarm monitoring, or as a system integrator.
Strong technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with experience managing remote and on-site security system support.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Entrepreneurial mindset with a bias for action, adaptability to ambiguity, and a focus on delivering results.
High level of integrity, discretion, and professionalism in handling security matters.
Strong business acumen, able to work within a budget and demonstrate sound decision-making capabilities.
Expertise in physical security design, development, and implementation.
Exceptional analytical and organizational skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and influencing skills, with the ability to gain stakeholder buy-in and navigate a complex organization.
Ability to travel up to 50% within the U.S. and globally as required.
Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, or holidays as necessary.
Ability to remain in a stationary position for extended periods (e.g., sitting or standing).
Ability to move about within an office, store, or warehouse environment.
Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. as needed.

Preferred Qualifications:

Professional certifications such as Axis, Hanwha, Lenel, DMP, or similar.
Hands-on technical experience with security systems and a working knowledge of basic electronic concepts.
Proven experience with Windows and Linux server management, access control and VMS programming, SQL
Experience with security and life safety best practices, particularly in retail and distribution environments.
Background in project management, risk assessments, and threat vulnerability analysis.

Title: Software Engineer II, Global Supply Technology
RoleDescription:
Location: Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are
Wayfair is one of the worlds largest destinations for the home, powered by a complex technology ecosystem that enables millions of customers to find the right products, at the right price, delivered seamlessly to their doorsteps.
Pricing and profitability are at the heart of Wayfairs strategy, and the algorithms that support them are critical to ensuring we remain competitive and sustainable. We are building horizontally scalable systems that power price generation, simulations, and profitability modelingrelying on data, experimentation, and machine learning to guide our decisions. These systems enable us to react quickly to market trends, optimize gross margins, and ensure an outstanding customer experience.
We are looking for passionate backend engineers to help us build and scale these mission-critical systems that drive decisions across pricing, profit, product placement, and customer satisfaction. This role sits at the intersection of backend engineering, data platforms, and applied machine learningtransforming experimental models into reliable, production-ready systems that operate at scale. Engineers in this space will not only solve complex technical challenges but also directly shape the way Wayfair competes in the global marketplace through smarter pricing and profitability strategies.
What Youll Do

Collaborate with Data Scientists and fellow Software Engineers to bring ML models into production.
Design, build, and maintain backend services and data pipelines that enable data-driven decision-making.
Write efficient, scalable, and maintainable code in Python, with a focus on high reliability and performance.
Develop and optimize Google BigQuery (GBQ)/SQL queries, including joins and aggregations across large datasets.
Ensure production readiness through testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation, and proactive troubleshooting.
Use orchestration tools (e.g., Cloud Composer) to schedule and manage workflows.
Support report generation and integrations with tools like Looker Studio or similar.
Take ownership of projects end-to-end, from design and implementation to scaling and ongoing maintenance.
Balance the open-ended nature of science-driven experiments with the rigor of production-grade engineering.

We Are a Match Because You Have

3  5 years of experience in backend software engineering with strong Python development skills.
Experience with SQL/GBQ, including writing queries and handling large-scale data.
Proven experience building and maintaining production systems with a focus on reliability.
A strong sense of ownership, curiosity, and continuous improvement mindset.
Excellent problem-solving and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical partners.

Nice to Have:

Experience working with Data Scientists to productionize ML models.
Familiarity with orchestration software (e.g., Cloud Composer, Airflow).
Experience with monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., DataDog, Prometheus).
Exposure to reporting/visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Tableau).

 Why Wayfair? Youll be part of a global engineering organization solving some of the hardest e-commerce challenges at scale. Title: Workflow Controller
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $102,942.00-$113,778.00 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
 Workflow Controller 
 
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
 
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements
Beyond optimizing plans and backlogs, you will also directly empower and lead a small, dedicated team of warehouse associates, fostering a high-performance environment and ensuring seamless execution of daily operations.
Provide leadership coverage, confidently supporting other teams, ensuring continuous operational excellence across the floor.

 
What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Title: Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry
RoleDescription:
Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091The entry pay for this position is $25/hr with uncapped quarterly bonus pay potential. Total compensation may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Overview:At Wayfair, we believe a home should be as functional as it is beautiful and that starts with great design. As a Sr. Retail Designer of Cabinetry and Home Renovation, you'll turn customer visions into reality, guiding them through their renovation journey with confidence, creativity, and care. From kitchens and bathrooms to laundry rooms and custom built-ins, you'll craft smart, stylish spaces that reflect each customers goals, budget, and style.
Youll tap into your expertise in cabinetry, bath, and kitchen design. Youll lean into Wayfairs expansive product catalog from cabinetry and tile to flooring and plumbing to provide complete solutions for DIY homeowners and professional contractors alike. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a passion for design and sales, and you love seeing a great project come to life, this is your stage.
What Does A Cabinetry and Home Renovation Designer Do?

 Own the Design Process: Lead cabinetry and home renovation projects from concept to completion. Use 2020 Design Live or similar software to develop layout plans, renderings, and product recommendations based on customer inputs, measurements, and needs.
 Be the Technical Expert: Educate customers on cabinetry construction types (framed vs. frameless), materials (MDF, plywood, solid wood), finishes (painted, stained, laminated), and specialty features (soft-close hinges, pull-outs, and more).
 Deliver Personalized Consultations: Whether it's in-store, virtual, or in-home, you'll meet customers where they are. You'll listen deeply, learn their style and renovation goals, and recommend functional, beautiful solutions tailored to their timeline and budget.
 Connect the Dots from Start to Finish: Develop floor plans, mood boards, 3D visuals, and complete product packages. You'll manage each projects full lifecycle, from early design to final purchase, and offer support through post-order services to ensure a smooth renovation experience.
 Educate + Inspire: Stay ahead of design trends and new materials, bringing fresh ideas to every customer interaction. Help customers see how tile, flooring, kitchen, bath, and plumbing products can work together to create the space theyve dreamed of.
 Leverage Design + Sales Tools: Use analytics and digital tools to build persuasive space plans, presentations, and shopping experiences that help grow the business while putting your creativity to work.
 Thrive in a Dynamic Environment: With evolving customer needs, product assortments, and promotions, youll stay focused, flexible, and ready to pivotall while delivering high-impact experiences.
 Always Be Selling (ABS): Every interaction is an opportunity. Youll generate new leads, build customer rapport, and close on personalized solutions that help grow your pipeline and the stores performance.
 Contribute to Store Success: Help with visual updates, floor sets, and inventory tasks as needed and bring your ideas to the table! Were a team that builds (and wins) together.

 
Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Design Experience: 3+ years of experience in kitchen, bath, cabinetry, or home renovation design. You know your way around spatial planning, product selection, and what works (and what wows). Bonus points for 12 years focused on cabinetry.
 Technical Proficiency: Youre confident working in 2020 Design software. Familiarity with CRM/POS systems (like Salesforce) helps too.
 Sales Know-How: Youve got a track record of meeting or beating your sales goals and you know how to build trust while selling big ideas and beautiful designs.
 Flexible Schedule: Retail hours mean nights, weekends, and holidays. Youre ready to show up when your customers need you most.
 Educational Background: A Bachelors degree or college diploma in a related field is preferred, but your experience and design sensibility speak volumes.
 Leadership + Training Experience: If youve mentored or trained others in a retail or design setting, even better! You know how to lift up your team and lead by example.
 Professional Certification (Preferred): NKBA, NAHB, NARI, or KBDI certifications are a plus and help you stand out as a true renovation pro.
 End-to-End Product Knowledge: You bring the full package from cabinetry to tile and have the confidence to guide customers through every step.
 Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in a team-focused environment and take pride in supporting your peers just as much as your customers.
 Top-Notch Organization: Strong attention to detail, follow-through, and communication make you a trusted partner from consultation to completion.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $102,942.00-$113,778.00 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Production Controller 
 
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
 
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements
Beyond optimizing plans and backlogs, you will also directly empower and lead a small, dedicated team of warehouse associates, fostering a high-performance environment and ensuring seamless execution of daily operations.
Provide leadership coverage, confidently supporting other teams, ensuring continuous operational excellence across the floor.

 
What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Overview:At Wayfair, we believe everyone deserves a home they love and as a Design Specialist, youll help make that happen. You'll be more than a salesperson; youll be a trusted design partner, guiding customers through everything from furniture selections to full-room transformations. Using your interior design expertise, trend awareness, and flair for customer service, youll help bring their vision to lifewhether in-store, virtually, or in their home.

Ready to help customers fall in love with their homes and your career? Lets make it happen.

 Be the Customers Trusted Advisor: Greet, listen, and learn. Youll lead design consultations that feel more like conversations, getting to know your customers style, needs, and how they really live. What is Supplier Inventory Management at Wayfair?
At Wayfair, Supplier Inventory Management (SIM) sits at the core of delivering a world-class customer experience. We partner with suppliers to maximise speed, availability, and efficiency across the supply chain. This means ensuring the right products are available at the right time  driving growth through smarter inventory positioning strategies and strong supplier collaboration. We leverage both Wayfairs fulfillment services (CastleGate) and suppliers own supply chain capabilities to optimise availability, cost, and scale.
As an Intern, youll step directly into this dynamic, data-driven environment  tackling real business challenges, solving problems, and delivering tangible results.

Your exact responsibilities will depend on your skills, interests, and team placement, but heres a snapshot of the impact you could have:


Develop & Execute Strategies: Optimise sales, in-stock rates, inventory turns, and network balance to drive growth.

Own Projects: Lead initiatives such as promotional inventory planning, forward positioning, and sell-through actions.


Analyse & Optimise: Monitor key performance indicators, conduct root cause analysis, and implement corrective actions.


Strategise & Scale: Influence supplier assortment, availability, and operational strategies using insights from your analysis.

Fluency in English, both written and spoken.

Proficient in Excel and a curiosity for working with data.

Collaborate with top talent and gain exposure to multiple business areas, from supply chain to marketing.


Benefit from hands-on mentorship designed to accelerate your learning.


Experience our vibrant, collaborative London office culture.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Fulfillment Orchestration
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, MA, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
The salary range for this position is $161,000 - $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will also be provided as part of the compensation package.
 
Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a critical role in making this vision a reality by building technology that solves meaningful customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways. We work closely with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics, Third Party system and service providers and business leaders across the company to bring these solutions to life.
We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager for Supply Chain and Retail Technology to lead the build out of our Fulfillment Lifecycle State and Orchestration system. This tech provides instructions needed for various supply chain tech systems to fulfill the order and subsequently, keeps track of the fulfillment journey to take appropriate actions based on the happy and unhappy path scenarios. In this role, you will have the opportunity to operate in a greenfield space and be hands-on to build something that plays a critical role within the Wayfair supply chain ecosystem.
Youll act as a connective tissue between engineering, business stakeholders, operations, and external partners to deliver scalable and resilient solutions that power key business functions. This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in cross-functional environments, can manage complex technical ecosystems, and is passionate about building something foundational and large scale that powers Wayfair supply chain. 
 
What Youll Do:

Build out the Fulfillment Lifecycle State and Orchestration systems by supporting new use cases and furthering the role that this system plays within Wayfair supply chain 
Lead Cross-Functional Initiatives by being the product lead for major, time-sensitive programs like 3P WMS integration, and Multichannel capabilities that bring value for the business and customers
Define future looking use cases through learnings from the existing capabilities, strong product discovery, and stakeholder feedback for mid to long term buildout.
Lead discovery efforts to gather and translate stakeholder needs into clear business and technical requirements.
Collaborate independently with Operations and Commercial stakeholders, and technology teams across supply chain, storefront and supplier-facing to drive improvements in speed, cost and customer experience metrics.

 
What You'll Need:

7+ years of product management experience, ideally focused on enterprise platforms, or integrations.
Strong track record of product discovery, defining the right problems to solve, and executing deliverables to solve those problems and unlock business outcomes
Comfortable discussing system workflows, tech design, and architecture decisions with engineers.
Experience in managing complex projects involving multiple cross-functional teams. 
Skilled at managing stakeholders, including senior leadership, and translating technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Strong communicator with a proven ability to collaborate across engineering, operations, and external partners. 
Positive, collaborative, and energetic approach to teamwork.
